data: Career Resources This central hub provides students with access to a wide range of career development tools and resources. It includes links to resume samples, career assessments, writing support, and various databases to research careers and salaries. Professional Documentation : Jonsson School Resume Template with Instructions ATS Checklist Creating Strong Resume Bullet Points Engineering Action Verbs The sample resumes provided below represent possible formatting styles that are ATS friendly; however, we recommend using the major specific resume samples for major specific content. You can use any format regardless of major. The document resources are provided as a reference and are not meant to be copied word for word. Please tailor to your experience and updated information. Computer Science Resume Example Biomedical Engineering Resume Example Electrical Engineering Resume Example Mechanical Engineering Resume Example Cover Letter Guide and Example Access a variety of resume templates tailored to different fields and levels of experience. These samples provide a strong starting point for crafting resumes, ensuring they meet industry standards and effectively showcase skills and achievements. Interview Preparation Interviewing is an essential part of the job searching process. We highly recommend that you prepare thoughtfully by researching the company and practicing interview questions ahead of time to help increase your confidence and help you stand out! The below pdf has general interview tips, common interview questions, behavioral interview questions, and possible questions to ask an Interview. Interview Preparation Quinncia Quinncia is a virtual platform helping job seekers enhance resumes, practice interviews, and receive personalized feedback through AI-driven tools. It offers automated resume reviews to optimize resume applicant tracking systems, mock interviews with real-time feedback, LinkedIn reviews, and other resources. A UT Dallas NetID is required for access. YouTube Channel Explore our YouTube channel for a collection of videos on career-related topics, including resume writing, interview preparation, networking tips, and more. These videos provide practical advice and insights from career experts. UTD Writing Center The UTD Writing Center offers personalized assistance with all stages of the writing process, including resumes, cover letters, and personal statements. Schedule a session to receive feedback and improve writing skills. Review UCC Resource Library The University Career Center (UCC) Resource Library houses a wealth of information on various career-related topics. This includes guides, books, and online resources to help with exploration of career paths, prepare for job applications, and develop professional skills. Career Assessment Focus 2 Focus 2 is an online career and education planning system helping users explore majors and careers aligned with their interests and skills. Use this resource to effectively plan academic and career goals. A UTD email address and the access code, utdcomets, is required. International & FirstGen Support Access resources specifically designed to support international students and first-generation college students. This includes guidance on navigating cultural differences, visa requirements, and unique challenges faced by these groups. Interstride Interstride is a platform that provides international students with resources to enhance their career opportunities. It offers job listings, webinars, and tools to help with the job search and application process. Career Spring Career Spring connects first-generation students with mentors, internships, and job opportunities. It offers a network of support to help graduates transition from college to career successfully. Major & Occupations Research Focus 2 is an online career and education planning system that helps students explore. Occupational Network Information (O*Net) O*Net is a comprehensive database of occupational information. It includes detailed descriptions of job roles, required skills, and educational requirements to help users make informed career decisions. Occupational Outlook Handbook (OOH) The Occupational Outlook Handbook provides information on job outlook, salary data, and required qualifications for a wide range of occupations. Use this resource to research potential careers and understand industry trends. What can I do with this major? This tool shares various career paths associated with different majors. It provides links to specific job descriptions, potential employers and strategies to maximize career opportunities. Salary and Negotiation Tools Access resources to research salary data and develop negotiation skills. This section includes tools like Seek UT, Payscale, and the Occupational Outlook Handbook to help users understand salary trends and negotiate job offers effectively. Seek UT Seek UT provides salary data and employment outcomes for graduates of the University of Texas system. Use this tool to understand potential earnings and career prospects based on fields of study. Payscale Payscale offers detailed salary reports and compensation data for a wide range of professions. It provides insights into industry standards and helps users prepare for salary negotiations. The OOH offers comprehensive information on various occupations, including salary ranges, job growth projections, and educational requirements. This tool is essential for researching potential careers and making informed decisions.
